alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:01PM EDT until June 25 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HILLSDALE...CENTRAL WILLIAMS AND WESTERN FULTON COUNTIES... At 500 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Hillsdale to near Fayette to West Unity, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Bryan, Archbold, Montpelier, Edgerton, West Unity, Pioneer, Stryker, Fayette, Holiday City, West Jefferson, Cambria, Pulaski, Pittsford, Ransom, Waldron, Prattville, Alvordton, Melbern, Shadyside and Osseo. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 27. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan...and northwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
